Class ZagTurtle

java.lang.Object
  TurtleDecorator
      ZagTurtle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Turtle
public class ZagTurtle
extends TurtleDecorator

A "fractalizing" turtle decorator that breaks each line into recursive fractal parts to create a self-similar zagging pattern.

Author:
Ilkka Kokkarinen

Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from class TurtleDecorator
turtle
 
Constructor Summary
ZagTurtle(Turtle turtle, double angle, double cutoff)
          To create a ZagTurtle, you need to provide the zagging angle and the cutoff threshold when to stop subdividing the motion.
 
Method Summary
 void move(double dist)
          The zagging motion is implemented by a couple of turns and moves, ending the turtle with the same position and heading as if the move had been done directly as given.

Constructor Detail

ZagTurtle

public ZagTurtle(Turtle turtle,
                 double angle,
                 double cutoff)
To create a ZagTurtle, you need to provide the zagging angle and the cutoff threshold when to stop subdividing the motion.

Parameters:
angle - The angle of each individual zag.
cutoff - Once the individual movement is shorter than this, no zagging is done.
Method Detail

move

public void move(double dist)
The zagging motion is implemented by a couple of turns and moves, ending the turtle with the same position and heading as if the move had been done directly as given.

Specified by:
move in interface Turtle
Overrides:
move in class TurtleDecorator
Parameters:
dist - The distance to move forward to the current heading.
